examples: He feels the cold a lot.
The film caught a cold over the outstanding debt.
Sarah’s got a cold.
On the day of the wedding, Brown experienced cold feet.
He's out cold and as still as a stone.
words.defineEn: having a temperature lower than the human body's average temperature
words.defineVi: có nhiệt độ thấp hơn nhiệt độ trung bình của cơ thể con người

examples: The weather was disagreeably hot.
The news came hot on the heels of another plane crash.
The factory closure follows hot on the heels of several others
The winter issue is hot off the press.
That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
words.defineEn: having a high temperature or a high degree of heat
words.defineVi: có nhiệt độ cao hoặc nhiệt độ cao

examples: The cloudy sky created a dramatic backdrop for the sunset.
The weather forecast predicted a cloudy morning followed by clearing in the afternoon.
I carried an umbrella with me because the weather looked cloudy.
We decided to postpone our outdoor plans due to the cloudy weather.
I couldn't see any stars because it was too cloudy at night.
words.defineEn: having many clouds up in the sky
words.defineVi: có nhiều đám mây trên bầu trời

examples: I didn't have the foggiest idea what he was talking about.
I don't have the foggiest idea how to fix a car.
The glass gets foggy.
So the evolution of pterosaurs is still foggy.
They then put the spheres in a foggy wind tunnel.
words.defineEn: filled with or full of fog

examples: The flowers bloomed under the sunny sky.
We often have a picnic in the park on sunny Sundays.
The sunny weather melted the snow, revealing patches of green grass.
He flew a kite in the park on a sunny day.
The sunny day encouraged us to go for a bike ride.
words.defineEn: very bright because there is a lot of light coming from the sun
words.defineVi: rất sáng vì có rất nhiều ánh sáng từ mặt trời

examples: It's windy!
It was windy.
it's not windy?
They put hundreds of wind machines in windy places.
And it may be windy.
words.defineEn: with a lot of winds or exposed to winds
words.defineVi: với rất nhiều gió hoặc tiếp xúc với gió

examples: Spring came late this year.
When I saw the old photograph, memories of my childhood home and the sounds of my mother's laughter sprang into my mind.
His new book will be appearing in the spring.
There are four seasons in a year: spring, summer, autumn, and winter.
In spring and summer, watch for kingfishers.
words.defineEn: the season that comes after winter, when in most countries the trees and flowers begin to grow again
words.defineVi: mùa đến sau mùa đông, khi ở hầu hết các quốc gia, cây và hoa bắt đầu mọc trở lại

examples: Summer is the season for outdoor concerts and festivals.
My grandmother makes the most amazing damson jam every summer.
I hate summer vacation.
I really love summer evenings.
The college runs summer courses for foreign students.
words.defineEn: the season that comes after spring and in most countries summer is the warmest season
words.defineVi: mùa đến sau mùa xuân và ở hầu hết các quốc gia, mùa hè là mùa ấm nhất

examples: Leaves change colour in autumn.
The leaves fall from the trees in autumn.
There are four seasons in a year: spring, summer, autumn, and winter.
August marks the end of summer and the beginning of autumn in some parts of the world.
In September, the weather starts to cool down as autumn approaches.
words.defineEn: the season after summer and before winter when the leaves change color and fall from the trees
words.defineVi: mùa sau mùa hè và trước mùa đông khi lá đổi màu và rụng khỏi cây

examples: Winter brings a peaceful silence, especially after a fresh snowfall.
In many Asian countries, winter melon is a staple ingredient in traditional dishes.
The winter issue is hot off the press.
Winter is the time when people celebrate holidays like Christmas and New Year's.
All winter coats are half-price today.
words.defineEn: the season that comes after fall and in most countries winter is the coldest season
words.defineVi: mùa đến sau mùa thu và ở hầu hết các quốc gia, mùa đông là mùa lạnh nhất

examples: Bad weather brought chaos to the utility companies.
The weather was disagreeably hot.
The weather turned quite chilly in the afternoon.
The bad weather brought famine.
Good afternoon, the weather is perfect for a walk.
words.defineEn: the temperature and other atmospheric conditions such as sunshine, rain, wind, etc.
words.defineVi: nhiệt độ và các điều kiện khí quyển khác như nắng, mưa, gió, v.v.

examples: Election season always puts my dad's back up.
The season starts in September.
She seasoned the meat with herbs and spices before cooking.
Tomatoes are out of season now.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
words.defineEn: a period of time that a year is divided into, such as winter and summer, with each having three months
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian mà một năm được chia thành, chẳng hạn như mùa đông và mùa hè, mỗi người có ba tháng

examples: Rain is the kiss of death for a barbecue.
Come rain or shine.
The team rained down blows on their opponents, overwhelming them with a flurry of punches.
Could I take a rain check?
This rain looks as if it has set in for the rest of the day.
words.defineEn: (of water) to fall from the sky in the shape of small drops
words.defineVi: (của nước) từ trên trời rơi xuống dưới hình dạng những giọt nước nhỏ

examples: The sunny weather melted the snow, revealing patches of green grass.
As a vegetarian, she often used snow peas as a substitute for meat in her stir-fry dishes.
The sledge ran smoothly over the frozen snow.
The snow on the roof started to melt in the warmth of the sun.
This new snow shovel makes short work of clearing off the driveway.
words.defineEn: (of water) to fall from the sky in the shape of small and soft ice crystals
words.defineVi: (của nước) từ trên trời rơi xuống dưới dạng tinh thể băng nhỏ và mềm
